summary: This is a Clerk's Notice of Nonconforming Document from the Clark County, Nevada District Court regarding case D-20-606708-L. The notice states that a 'Motion to Correct Clerical Mistake' filed by Carmit Cipolla was nonconforming, resulting in the case being closed and designated as filed in error. The document is administrative and relates to filing procedural errors, not substantive case details.

persons.name: Carmit Pesia Cipolla

persons.name: Giuseppe Cipolla

connections.description: Listed as plaintiff and defendant, respectively, in a civil case in Clark County, Nevada District Court.

events.title: Nonconforming Motion Filed
events.description: Carmit Cipolla electronically filed a 'Motion to Correct Clerical Mistake (Upside down)' which was determined to be nonconforming as it did not initiate a civil action properly and lacked a required hearing designation.

events.title: Case Closed and Notice Served
events.description: The court issued a Clerk's Notice of Nonconforming Document, striking the filing from the record, closing the case as filed in error, and returning any filing fee. The notice was served via the electronic filing system.

keyFacts: The document is a procedural notice from a Nevada court regarding a filing error, not a substantive document related to the Epstein case.
The case (D-20-606708-L) involved Carmit Pesia Cipolla as plaintiff and Giuseppe Cipolla as defendant and was closed due to a nonconforming motion.
The nonconforming motion was titled 'Motion to Correct Clerical Mistake (Upside down)' and was filed by Carmit Cipolla on April 17, 2020.
The case was designated as 'filed in error' and stricken from the record because the document did not properly initiate a civil action and lacked a required hearing designation.

The document's inclusion in the Epstein case data set (EFTA00151195) appears to be incidental or an error in document collection, as it contains no references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, victims, or related entities.
